Description: Timestamp of the first packet of the connection
Populated When: Always - every connection has a start time
Behavioral Relevance: Temporal patterns can reveal scheduled attacks or time-based anomalies

Description: Source IP address of the connection initiator

Behavioral Relevance: MEDIUM - Ephemeral ports vary, but patterns may emerge

Description: Destination IP address (target of the connection)
Transport layer protocol (TCP, UDP, ICMP, etc.)
Behavioral Relevance: HIGH - Different protocols have different attack vectors

Description: Application layer protocol/service detected (http, dns, ssh, etc.)
Populated When: Service could be identified from traffic
Behavioral Relevance: HIGH - Service-specific attacks target specific services

Description: Total duration of the connection in seconds
Populated When: Connection has defined start and end
Behavioral Relevance: HIGH - Short bursts may indicate scans, long connections may indicate C2

Description: Total bytes sent from source to destination
Behavioral Relevance: HIGH - Data exfiltration detection, traffic volume anomalies

Description: Total bytes sent from destination to source
Empty/Dash When: Zero if no response or unidirectional

Description: Zeek connection state code (S0, S1, SF, REJ, RSTO, etc.)
Behavioral Relevance: VERY HIGH - Connection states reveal attack signatures

Description: Bytes missed due to packet loss or capture limitations
Number of packets from source to destination
Number of packets from destination to source

Behavioral Relevance: N/A - This is the target variable

Description: Attack type label (e.g., normal, ddos, injection, etc.)
Behavioral Relevance: N/A - This is the target variable
